requirements.summary: Increase the opacity of the global html linear-gradient overlay (default and mobile/portrait) to darken the site-wide background without changing image paths or background behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/index.css, the linear-gradient overlay alpha values applied to the html background-image are increased (darker) for both the default and the mobile/portrait @media rule.
The background images remain exactly: /assets/generated/site-background-neon-bubbles.dim_1920x1080.png and /assets/generated/site-background-neon-bubbles-mobile.dim_1080x1920.png.
The background properties remain in effect: background-size: cover; background-position: center; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-attachment: fixed.
Foreground content (text/buttons/cards) remains readable and the bubble overlay decorations remain visible against the darker background.

file_operations.description: Increase the rgba alpha values in the html background-image linear-gradient overlay for both the default rule and the (max-width: 768px)/(orientation: portrait) @media rule (e.g., raise from 0.5 to a darker value). Keep the background image URLs exactly as /assets/generated/site-background-neon-bubbles.dim_1920x1080.png and /assets/generated/site-background-neon-bubbles-mobile.dim_1080x1920.png, and preserve background-size: cover; background-position: center; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-attachment: fixed.
